vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in immer
vulnerabilities.description: This affects the package immer before 9.0.6. A type confusion vulnerability can lead to a bypass of CVE-2020-28477 when the user-provided keys used in the path parameter are arrays. In particular, this bypass is possible because the condition `(p === "__proto__" || p === "constructor")` in `applyPatches_` returns false if `p` is `['__proto__']` (or `['constructor']`). The `===` operator (strict equality operator) returns false if the operands have different type.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in immer
Prototype Pollution in immer
vulnerabilities.description: immer is vulnerable to Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution').
